intro: Lepidaploa amambaia, commonly known as the Amambaia pincushion, is a flowering plant native to the high Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat. Lepidaploa amambaia is also of interest to botanists due to its potential medicinal properties.
